How toxic air is impacting India’s athletes: ‘Eye irritation causes blurring, impacts a shot,’ says national shooting coach Deepali Deshpande
Accenture CEO Julie Sweet to CEOs: 'In three years, you should be able to say…'
description: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: ICC considers 'strict action' against Bangladesh; Jay Shah in Dubai for final decision
description: The ICC is considering action against Bangladesh for refusing to tour India for the T20 World Cup 2026 due to security concerns. Bangladesh's request to shift matches to Sri Lanka was rejected, potentially leading to Scotland's replacement. The dispute escalated after a Bangladeshi player's IPL removal.

title: T20 WC row: BCB's DRC move hits dead end; Scotland all set to replace Bangladesh
description: Bangladesh Cricket Board has appealed to the ICC's Dispute Resolution Committee regarding their T20 World Cup matches being held in India, despite the committee lacking authority over such decisions. This move follows the interim government's refusal to travel, citing security concerns. The ICC Board had previously approved India as the venue.

description: RBI is not among the largest holders of US government debt, with its exposure at about a quarter of China’s nearly $683 billion holdings. Even so, India’s selling has added fresh momentum to discussions about the place of US sovereign bonds in global investment portfolios.

'Very interesting': Trump on Putin's offer to pay $1bn Board of Peace fee with frozen assets
description: US President Trump reacted positively to Russian President Putin's offer to contribute $1 billion to his proposed "Board of Peace," suggesting he would accept if the funds were Putin's own. Putin indicated frozen Russian assets could be used for this, and later to rebuild Ukraine. Trump signed the charter for the body, which aims to oversee peace efforts globally.

title: Amazon preparing for another round of layoffs, thousands of jobs under scanner
description: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: Couple found dead in Ahmedabad flat: Congress MP’s nephew ‘accidentally’ shoots wife
description: Tragedy struck in Ahmedabad as Yashrajsinh Gohil, nephew of a Rajya Sabha MP, allegedly shot his wife Rajeshwari with his licensed revolver before taking his own life. The couple, married for two months, had returned from a social event. Police are investigating the sequence of events, with initial findings suggesting accidental firing followed by suicide.

title: CBI escalates Noida sports city probe: Agency arrests Wiztown director
description: The tragic death of a techie has intensified the CBI's probe into Noida's Sports City project, focusing on Wiztown Planners Pvt Ltd. The investigation into alleged irregularities, including financial losses and regulatory lapses, has widened following the incident and a CAG report highlighting systemic failures.
